definition: to catch sight of in a doorway (old)
board/plank/plate/shutter/table tennis bat/clappers (music)/CL:塊|块[kuai4]/accented beat in Chinese music/hard/stiff/to stop smiling or look serious

sentences.english: Lay cooled sponge cake flat on cutting board.
sentences.chinese: 将已冷却的蛋糕放在案板上。

sentences.english: Turn out on counter and knead for 5 minutes.
sentences.chinese: 将面团从锅中取出，在案板上揉捏5分钟。

sentences.english: The house features an open kitchen plan with granite counter tops, wood flooring and cabinets.
sentences.chinese: 有一个露天的大理石案板厨房，木质地板和衣柜。

sentences.english: Use a cutting board for god's sake.
sentences.chinese: 看在上帝的份上，用案板吧。

sentences.english: I tore it open excitedly. It was a large, wooden chopping board.
sentences.chinese: 我激动不已的打开，它却是一块硕大的木制案板。

sentences.english: Be careful now. Use your other hand to keep the fish in place.
sentences.chinese: 现在要非常小心，用你的另一只手将鱼还放在案板上。

sentences.english: Do not use the same chopping board or the same knife.
sentences.chinese: 不使用同一块案板或同一把刀。

sentences.english: In addition, the kitchen chopping board must be separated from raw and cooked, should not mix.
sentences.chinese: 另外，厨房内的案板一定要生熟分开，不能混用。

definition: see 鍋|锅[guo1]/see 涮鍋子|涮锅子[shuan4 guo1 zi5]/bowl (of a smoking pipe etc)
